Reported robust growth across key business indicators for Q3; Gross advances surged 11.9% YoY and average deposits grew 12.2% YoY; Analyst consensus (46 out of 48) maintains a 'buy' rating with an average 12-month target implying 16.9% upside, despite ADR slump.
Q3 Business Update: Deposits, Loan Book Grows In Double-Digits.
Q3 Business Update: Loan Book Falls 13%, CASA Ratio Contracts; Net advances as of Dec 31 down 13.1% YoY, Deposits down 3.8% YoY; Loan growth moderation driven by the MFI segment.

HSBC maintained a 'buy' call and hiked target price from Rs 17,000 to Rs 18,500, citing strong demand outlook and market share returning to normalized levels (40%); Q3 and Q4 margin delivery could prove critical.

JLR division reported a 43% fall in Q3FY26 wholesales and 25% fall in retail sales, impacted by a cyberattack disrupting production, planned wind-down of legacy Jaguar models, and incremental US tariffs.

Macquarie downgraded to Neutral from Buy and slashed target price to Rs 330 from Rs 500, citing the adverse impact of a sharp cigarette tax hike (40–50%) expected to weigh heavily on volumes, mix and profitability over the next two years; EPS estimates cut by 18%.
Launches New XUV 7XO at starting price of Rs 13.66 lakh (ex-showroom).
The company's arm raises Rs 1,003 crore for Lithium-Ion Cell & Battery Manufacturing Unit.
Company expects third quarter consolidated net profit to grow faster than revenue; consolidated revenue to grow in mid-single digits; India home & personal care business to grow in double digits.
Q3 Standalone revenue up 17% at Rs 5,220 crore (YoY).

Citi maintains a Buy rating with a target price of Rs 330; Q3 Retail Disbursements up 49% at Rs 22,690 crore (YoY); Retail Loan Book as of Dec 31 up 21% at Rs 1.12 lakh crore (YoY); Disbursement growth remains strong at over 40% YoY and 19% QoQ.
Total Deposits as on Dec 31 up 15% At Rs 12.61 lakh crore (YoY); Gross Advances as on Dec 31 up 14.1% At Rs 11.71 lakh crore (YoY); Surprised positively on deposit growth.
Q2 EARNINGS (YoY) Revenue up 50.7% At Rs 712 crore; Ebitda up 74.2% At Rs 46.1 crore; Net Profit at Rs 29.6 crore.
Key personal accidentally leaked draft third quarter financials on WhatsApp and company have reported the same to exchanges.
Recorded low single-digit volume growth in Q3; growth driven by uptick in edible oil and food and FMCG segments; distribution footprint expanded.
Reported a 37% YoY growth in sales to 2.1 million tonnes in December 2025.
Prasad Ellatch Chathuar Joins as senior management personnel and chief financial officer.
The company approves issuance of non-convertible debentures worth Rs 100 crore on private placement basis.
Net advances as of Dec 31 up 16.2% at Rs 4.66 lakh crore (YoY); CASA up 9% at Rs 2.1 lakh crore (YoY); Total deposits up 14.7% at Rs 5.26 lakh crore (YoY); Reported strong loan growth.
Q3 electricity traded volume up 11.9% at 34.08 BU (YoY); December electricity traded volume up 2.8% at 11.44 BU (YoY).
Total deposits as of Dec 31 up 4.5% YoY, but Gross loan portfolio down 3.9% YoY; CASA ratio improved.
Q3 manganese ore production up 3.7% at 4.77 lakh tonnes (YoY).
Dec Handled Cargo Volume up 9% At 41.9 MMT (YoY).
December CFS volumes jump 18% YoY AT 61200 TEUs.
To be excluded from Short - Term ASM Framework Stage - I.
To be excluded from Short - Term ASM Framework Stage - I.
Price band changed from 20% to 10%.
Successfully pivoted to AI, made strides into AI-generated video, leading to an 84% stock surge over the past year.

JM Financial recommends buying at Rs 388 for a target of Rs 412 - Rs 423; Motilal Oswal reiterated a Buy rating with a target price of Rs 500, implying a 31% upside, backed by aggressive expansion in renewables, transmission, and distribution, with Ebitda and PAT expected to double by FY30.
Kunal Rambhia recommended buying at Rs 1,488 with a target price of Rs 1,700.
Osho Krishan advised a buy on Asian Paints at Rs 1,310, aiming for a target of Rs 1,380.
Ruchit Jain suggested purchasing Uno Minda at Rs 1,335, with a target of Rs 1,400.
Raja Venkatraman placed a buy call on Voltas at Rs 1,477, with a target of Rs 1,505.

Citi maintains a Sell rating with a target price of Rs 5,480; Investor expectations of double-digit exit revenue growth for FY26 and FY27 appear challenging; Further EBIT margin expansion could be difficult amid sector-wide pressures.

Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 320; India’s solar installations are expected to grow at a 24% CAGR over FY25–28; Early entry into TOPCon, DCR-led profitability and a well-funded balance sheet provide an edge; Trades at nearly a 50% discount to peers.
InCred initiates coverage with a Hold rating and a target price of Rs 4,187; Near-term order inflows are seen peaking; Domestic core segment orders are expected to decline 19% YoY in H2 FY26.
